position.marginalia_text: Qua[e] potissimùm notauit Quinctilianus, ea semper curiosè animaduerte. Nec non ea, qua[e] Pontanus accuratè obseruauit, aut Sigonius. Certè Liuius usquequaq[ue] elegans, prudens, pragmaticus, et momentosus. Compara Gra[e]corum solertissimos: vix aliquid tam sagacis ingenij, aut tam arcani iudicij in singulis vbiq[ue] rebus enucleandis.

marginalia.translation: Always pay close attention to what Quintilian chiefly observed. And also to what Pontanus carefully noted, or Sigonius. Surely Livy is elegant at every place, sagacious, pragmatic and quick. Compare [him with] the most experts ones of the Greeks: there is hardly anything of such perceptive intelligence, or such intimate judgement in explaining specific issues anywhere.
